name: McCleskey v. Kemp
question: Did the statistical study prove that McCleskey's sentence violated the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments?
description: A case in which the Court decided it was not a violation of the Eighth Amendment when purposeful discrimination could not be proven.

name: Interstate Commerce Commission v. Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers
Anderson v. Creighton
question: Can a federal officer who participated in a search that violated the Fourth Amendment be held personally liable for monetary damages if a reasonable officer would have assumed that the search comported with the Fourth Amendment?

name: Turner v. Safley
question:
1. Was the Missouri Department of Corrections’ restriction limiting correspondence between inmates a violation of those prisoners’ First Amendment rights?

2. Was the Missouri Department of Corrections' restriction limiting prisoners’ ability to marry a violation of prisoners’ constitutional right to marry?

name: Colorado v. Spring
question: Is the suspect’s awareness of the crimes about which he may be questioned relevant to his informed decision to waive his Fifth Amendment rights?

name: Wright v. City of Roanoke Redevelopment & Housing Authority
Société Nationale Industrielle Aérospatiale v. United States District Court for the Southern District of Iowa
CTS Corporation v. Dynamics Corporation of America
Amoco Production Company v. Village of Gambell
Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Cardoza-Fonseca
Ansonia Board of Education v. Philbrook
Utah Division of State Lands v. United States
United States v. Paradise
question: Did the one-black-for-one-white promotion scheme violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Board of Airport Commissioners of the City of Los Angeles v. Jews for Jesus, Inc.
question: Did the Los Angeles ordinance violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments of the Constitution?

name: Tashjian, Secretary of State of Connecticut v. Republican Party of Connecticut
Colorado v. Connelly
question: Did the taking of Connelly's statements as evidence violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Tanner v. United States
question: Was the district court required to hold a second evidentiary hearing to evaluate juror drug and alcohol use during the trial?

name: California v. Superior Court of California, San Bernardino County
Pope v. Illinois
question: May a jury be instructed to apply community standards regarding the value of a work to satisfy the third prong of the obscenity test established by the Court in Miller v. California?
description: A case in which the Court a jury may not be instructed to apply community standards regarding the value of a work to satisfy the third prong of the obscenity test established by the Court in Miller v. California.

name: Pilot Life Insurance Company v. Dedeaux
Federal Election Commission v. Massachusetts Citizens for Life, Inc.
question:
Did Massachusetts Citizens for Life violate the Federal Election Campaign Act by distributing flyers asking voters to vote “for life” paid for with treasury funds?

Does that section of FECA violate the First Amendment as applied?

name: Citicorp Industrial Credit, Inc. v. Brock
United States v. General Dynamics Corp.
Burlington Northern Railroad Company v. Brotherhood of Maintenance of Way Employes
question: Does the Norris-LaGuardia Act allow federal courts to issue an injunction on labor dispute activities that do not involve the primary actors?

name: Illinois v. Krull
question: Does the good faith exception to the exclusionary evidence rule apply when a police officer relied on a statute that was later held unconstitutional?

name: Agency Holding Corporation v. Malley-Duff & Associates, Inc.
United States v. Salerno
question: Did the Bail Reform Act violate the Fifth Amendment's Due Process Clause?

name: Bowen v. Gilliard
question: Does the Deficit Reduction Act of 1984, which requires a family’s eligibility for federal aid to take into account all incomes of all family members living in the same home, violate the Fifth Amendment?

name: Board of Directors, Rotary International v. Rotary Club of Duarte
question: Did a law which required California Rotary Clubs to admit women members violate Rotary International's First Amendment rights of association?

name: Rockford Life Insurance Company v. Illinois Department of Revenue
Fort Halifax Packing Company, Inc. v. Coyne
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Asphalt Products Company, Inc.
Burlington Northern Railroad Company v. Oklahoma Tax Commission
Wimberly v. Labor and Industrial Relations Commission of Missouri
Hodel v. Irving
question: Is the provision of the Indian Land Consolidation Act which would take Indians' fractional interest in land and convey those interests to the control of the tribal government an unconstitutional taking?

name: United States v. Cherokee Nation of Oklahoma
Shaare Tefila Congregation v. Cobb
question: Did the white defendants exhibit racially motivated discrimination in violation of the federal statute?

name: National Labor Relations Board v. International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers
Metropolitan Life Ins. Company v. Taylor
Nollan v. California Coastal Commission
question: Did the requirement constitute a property taking in violation of the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Hobbie v. Unemployment Appeals Comm'n of Florida
question: Did the state of Florida violate the Free Exercise Clause by denying unemployment benefits to an employee who was dismissed for refusing to work certain shifts because of conflicting religious obligations?

name: Sumner v. Nevada Department of Prisons
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Fink
United States v. John Doe, Inc. I
Asahi Metal Industry Co. v. Superior Court of Cal., Solano Cty.
question: Does the Superior Court of California, Solano County have jurisdiction over the Asahi Metal Industry Company under the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Rankin v. McPherson
question: Did the Constable's action infringe upon McPherson's freedom of speech guaranteed by the First Amendment?

name: Saint Francis College v. Al-Khazraji
question: Did 42 U.S.C. Section 1981 apply to Arab minorities?

name: Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway Company v. Buell
San Francisco Arts & Athletics, Inc. v. United States Olympic Committee
question: Currently unavailable.

name: Arizona v. Hicks
question: Was the search of the stereo equipment (a search beyond the exigencies of the original entry) reasonable under the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Richardson v. Marsh
question: In a joint trial, does the confession of one defendant without that defendant taking the stand violate the Confrontation Clause?

name: United States v. Stanley
question:
(1) Did the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit err in reinstating Stanley’s claims under the Federal Torts Claim Act?

(2) Did the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit err in determining that the Supreme Court’s decision in Chappell did not bar Stanley’s constitutional claims?

name: Cargill, Inc. v. Monfort of Colorado, Inc.
O'lone v. Estate Of Shabazz
question: If a prison policy infringes on inmates’ free exercise of religion, must the prison show that there are no reasonable alternatives that would accomplish the same goal without creating an actual security issue?

name: Keystone Bituminous Coal Association. v. DeBenedictis
question: Does a state violate the Takings Clause by forcing coal mining companies to keep certain amounts of coal in underground mines in order to support structures on the surface? Does this restriction violate the Contract Clause by canceling agreements miners have made to secure their rights to underground coal?

name: Edwards v. Aguillard
question: Did the Louisiana law, which mandated the teaching of "creation science" along with the theory of evolution, violate the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment as applied to the states through the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that it was a violation of the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment to mandate the teaching of creation science when teaching evolution science.

name: United States v. Dunn
question: Is a search warrant needed to peer into the open side of a barn that is located in a field on private property?

name: City of Houston, Texas v. Hill
Iowa Mutual Insurance Company v. LaPlante
City of Pleasant Grove v. United States
City of Newport, Kentucky v. Iacobucci, dba Talk of the Town
Tison v. Arizona
question: Does the “intent to kill” requirement for the death penalty include situations where an accomplice anticipated a potential for use of lethal force?

name: Puerto Rico v. Branstad
question: Do federal courts have the power to order governors to fulfill obligations under the Constitution's Extradition Clause in Article IV, Section 2?

name: Western Air Lines, Inc. v. Board of Equalization of the State of South Dakota
Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Hector
Fall River Dyeing & Finishing Corporation v. National Labor Relations Board
Griffith v. Kentucky
question: Could retroactive Supreme Court decisions be applied selectively to cases pending direct review or not yet final?

name: Johnson v. Transportation Agency, Santa Clara Cty.
question: Did the Agency impermissibly take into account the sex of the applicants in the promotion process and violate Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964?

name: Pennzoil Co. v. Texaco Inc.
question: Did the district court err in issuing an injunction instead of abstaining until the state court proceedings concluded?

name: Young v. United States ex rel. Vuitton et Fils S. A.
Stringfellow v. Concerned Neighbors in Action
International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, AFL-CIO v. Hechler
California Coastal Comm'n v. Granite Rock Company
Bourjaily v. United States
question: (1) In order to consider the statements of a coconspirator as non-hearsay, must the court determine by evidence independent of the statements themselves that the conspiracy existed and that the defendant and declarant were members of this conspiracy? (2) What is the quantum of proof on which such determinations must be based? (3) Must the court in each case examine the circumstances of such a statement to determine its reliability?

name: California v. Cabazon Band of Mission Indians
question: Do state and local governments have the authority to regulate gambling conducted on Indian reservation land?

name: South Dakota v. Dole
question: Did Congress exceed its spending powers, or violate the Twenty-first Amendment, by passing legislation conditioning the award of federal highway funds on the states' adoption of a uniform minimum drinking age?
description: A case in which the Court ruled that Congress did not exceed its spending powers or violate the Twenty-First Amendment when it conditioned the award of federal highway funds on states' adoption of a uniform minimum drinking age.

name: Federal Communications Commission v. Florida Power Corporation
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Groetzinger
question: Does a taxpayer’s gambling activity constitute as a “trade or business” under the Internal Revenue Code of 1964 and therefore allow a deduction of gambling losses to be deducted from gross income instead of constituting a requirement for the minimum tax?
description: A case in which the Court held that a taxpayer’s gambling activity does constitute a “trade or business” under the Internal Revenue Code of 1964.

name: Welch v. Texas Department of Highways and Public Transportation
Booth v. Maryland
question: Does the Eighth Amendment of the Constitution, which protects a defendant from cruel and unusual punishment, prohibit a jury from considering a victim impact statement during the sentencing phase of a capital murder trial?

name: American Trucking Associations, Inc. v. Scheiner
question: Do flat state taxes on the use of a state's highways run afoul of the Commerce Clause by discriminating against interstate commerce?

name: California Federal Savings & Loan Assn. v. Guerra, Director, Department of Fair Employment and Housing
Maryland v. Garrison
question: If the police were unaware that there were two apartments on the third floor, does the Warrant Clause of the Fourth Amendment prevent the use of a warrant to justify the seizure of evidence the police found in the second apartment?

name: Rock v. Arkansas
question: Does Arkansas’s blanket ban on all hypnotically refreshed testimony infringe on Vickie Rock’s Fourteenth, Fifth, and Sixth Amendment right to testify on her own behalf?
description: A case in which the Court held that Arkansas’s blanket ban on all hypnotically refreshed testimony infringed on Vickie Rock’s Fourteenth, Fifth, and Sixth Amendment right to testify on her own behalf.

name: Tyler Pipe Industries, Inc. v. Washington State Department of Revenue
Corporation of the Presiding Bishop of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints v. Amos
question: Does Section 702 of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 violate the Establishment Clause by allowing religious employers to choose employees for nonreligious jobs based on their religion?

name: Munro, Secretary of State of Washington v. Socialist Workers Party
North Carolina Department of Transportation v. Crest Street Community Council, Inc.
Griffin v. Wisconsin
question: Does a warrantless search of a probationer’s residence violate the Fourth Amendment if it was conducted on reasonable grounds?
description: A case in which the Court held that a warrantless search of a probationer’s residence does not violate the Fourth Amendment if it was conducted on reasonable grounds.

name: First English Evangelical Lutheran Church of Glendale v. County of Los Angeles, California
question: Did the ordinance violate the Fifth Amendment (as applied to the states through the Fourteenth) which prevents government from taking private property for public use without providing just compensation to the owner of the property?

name: Burlington Northern Railroad Company v. Woods
Arkansas Writers' Project, Inc. v. Ragland
O'Connor v. Ortega
question: Did the supervisor's search of the office violate Dr. Ortega's "reasonable expectation of privacy" guaranteed by the Fourth Amendment?

name: Gray v. Mississippi
question: Did the Supreme Court of Mississippi err in affirming Gray’s death sentence by holding that the excusal of a juror was a harmless error and not a violation of the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Crawford Fitting Company v. J. T. Gibbons, Inc.
School Board of Nassau County, Florida v. Arline
question: Does Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, which provides relief to handicapped individuals, extend relief to individuals afflicted with contagious diseases?

name: Jersey Shore State Bank v. United States
R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company v. Durham County, North Carolina
